authorsByline: Brian Lisik, Brian Lisik | brianlisik@yahoo.com, blisik
title: Driver evades police after running into a backyard: Avon Police Blotter
description: Also in this week’s Avon Police blotter, a driver is arrested for impaired driving on Interstate 90.
content:
Avon Police Department looking to fill open positions as well as lateral transfers.

A driver fled police following a traffic stop at 10:05 a.m. July 23 for an expired registration. Police chased the driver into the city of Lorain, where the driver parked the car in a driveway and fled on foot into a backyard. Police were unable to locate the man, but he was positively identified and a warrant was issued for his arrest. The car was towed from the scene.

A driver was pulled over at 9:50 p.m. July 29 for driving outside marked lanes. The driver was later operated for operating a motor vehicle while impaired.

Police responded to a report of a juvenile waving a firearm in the air at 8:52 p.m. July 30. Police gathered information at the scene and there was no further information at the time of the report.

A driver fled police following a traffic stop at 9:40 a.m. July 27. Police terminated the pursuit and there was no further information available at the time of the report.

Get police blotters by email every weekday for free with our new Police Blotter newsletter. Sign up at cleveland.com/newsletters.

Read more news from the Sun Sentinel.
summary: The Avon Police Department is looking to fill open positions and apprehend the perpetrators of these incidents. A driver who was pulled over for an expired registration fled police after a traffic stop and fled into a backyard, but was positively identified and a warrant was issued for his arrest. The vehicle was later towed away. Police also responded to a report of a juvenile waving a firearm in the air.
shortSummary: Avon Police are seeking information on potential job losses and potential replacements for missing potential replacements after a series of incidents involving fleeing police.
